<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18058>

Thomas Soeiro (<mailto:Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr|Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr

--- Comment #5 from Thomas Soeiro (<mailto:Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr|Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr>) ---
As mentionned in comment 1, this behavior is documented in
[?model.frame](<https://stat.ethz.ch/R-manual/R-devel/library/stats/html/model.frame.html>):

> Because variables in the formula are evaluated before rows are dropped based on `subset`, the characteristics of data-dependent bases such as orthogonal polynomials (i.e. from terms using [poly](<https://stat.ethz.ch/R-manual/R-devel/library/stats/help/poly.html>)) or splines will be computed based on the full data set rather than the subsetted one.

Since this behavior often confuses users (e.g.
[here](<https://github.com/therneau/survival/issues/47>) and
[here](<https://stackoverflow.com/q/56972168>)), it would be helpful to also
mention it in the documentation of both the modeling functions (e.g. `lm()`,
`glm()`) and the functions commonly used within formulas (e.g. `poly()`),
including those from recommended packages (e.g. `survival::coxph()`,
`survival::pspline()`, `survival::nsk()`, `splines::ns()`, `splines::bs()`).

<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18689>

Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) changed:

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED

--- Comment #2 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
Thinking about this again I really think we should not be adding specific code
to support Microsoft compilers when we can't tell whether the code is actually
correct (not even from the documentation, and we can't test), and I would not
use such compiler with R. I can't tell whether any of the proposed solutions
will reliably work. I think this should be a general rule, but specifically the
problems with interoperability between C/Fortran (and C++) on complex numbers
addressed in the header file are particularly subtle.

<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18932>

            Bug ID: 18932
           Summary: ?options could be clearer that

                    strings
           Product: R
           Version: R-devel (trunk)
          Hardware: All
                OS: All
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Documentation
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>

Created attachment 3524
  --> <https://bugs.r-project.org/attachment.cgi?id=3524&action=edit>
State clearly that env must be character string

I was looking for a way to set the default device to be `pdf(file=NULL)` for
running in an environment without write permissions, and came across this in
`?options`:

> The default values in interactive and non-interactive sessions are configurable via environment variables `R_INTERACTIVE_DEVICE` and `R_DEFAULT_DEVICE` respectively.

<https://github.com/r-devel/r-svn/blob/451916626a1565730274862f1913e2a29aad2467/src/library/base/man/options.Rd#L564-L567>

I was still hopeful I could do `R_DEFAULT_DEVICE="function(...)
pdf(file=NULL)"`; it tooking reading the source to dispel that notion:

<https://github.com/r-devel/r-svn/blob/451916626a1565730274862f1913e2a29aad2467/src/library/grDevices/R/zzz.R#L36>
<https://github.com/r-devel/r-svn/blob/451916626a1565730274862f1913e2a29aad2467/src/library/grDevices/R/device.R#L455>
<https://github.com/r-devel/r-svn/blob/451916626a1565730274862f1913e2a29aad2467/src/library/grDevices/R/device.R#L289-L296>

I think we could save that effort with a few extra words of clarity in the
paragraph, e.g. the attached patch.
